# track(_:cameraInformation:)

**Instance Method**

Automatically generate and send tracking vectors to the device.

## Declaration

```swift
final func track(_ metadata: [AVMetadataObject], cameraInformation: DockAccessory.CameraInformation) async throws
```

## Parameters

- **metadata**: An array of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVMetadataObject] objects indicating the location of objects within the frame.
- **cameraInformation**: The camera in current use and its orientation.

## Discussion

The vectors are based on metadata coming from the camera.

Disable system tracking, then supply the observations at a fixed rate between 10 and 30 times per second. Any other rate is unsupported.



## Selecting and tracking

- **selectSubject(at:)**: Selects a subject to track at the supplied coordinates.
- **track(_:cameraInformation:)**: Automatically generate and send tracking vectors to the device.
- **DockAccessory.Observation**: An observation of the contents of a single video frame.
- **DockAccessory.CameraInformation**: A collection of tracking information about the camera currently in use.
- **DockAccessory.CameraOrientation**: The set of camera orientations used to extract coordinates.
